questions.question: ST. PATRICK WAS BORN HERE, NOT IRELAND, AROUND THE 4TH CENTURY.
THESE REPTILES HAVE NEVER BEEN FOUND IN IRISH FOSSIL RECORDS SO THERE WAS NO NEED FOR ST. PATRICK TO BANISH THEM.
SHE IS IRELAND'S ONLY FEMALE PATRON SAINT.
ST. PATRICK USED THIS PLANT AS A SYMBOL OF THE HOLY TRINITY.
THE FIRST ST. PATRICK'S DAY PARADE WAS HELD IN THIS US STATE ON MARCH 17, 1601.
AN UNESCO WORLD HERITAGE SITE, THIS STRUCTURE IS OLDER THAT THE GREAT PYRAMID OF GIZA.
DURING THIS HOLIDAY AN UPRISING OCCURRED IN 1916.
IRELAND CALLED IT THE EMERGENCY, THE REST OF THE WORLD CALLED IT THIS.
HAILED AS THE LIBERATOR, HE FAILED IN THE END TO ESTABLISH AN IRISH PARLIAMNET.
IT WAS NOT UNTIL THIS YEAR THAT IRELAND WAS FORMALLY DECLARED A REPUBLIC.
THIS MUSICAL INSTRUMENT IS THE OFFICIAL EMBLEM OF IRELAND. IT IS ALSO ON A CAN OF GUINNESS.
THIS BAND IS THE BEST SELLING IRISH ACT OF ALL TIME WITH OVER 170 MILLION RECORDS SOLD.
THE CRANBERRIES RELEASED THIS SONG IN 1994, IT IS ABOUT THE TROUBLES, NOT BRAIN EATERS.
AS ONE OF THE EXPONENTS OF BLUE-EYED-SOUL, HE WAS THE LEAD SINGER OF "THEM" IN THE 60'S BEFORE GOING SOLO.
THIS TRADITIONAL IRISH FOLK BAND FORMED IN DUBLIN IN 1962. THEY WOULD GO ON TO POPULARISE IRISH MUSIC THROUGH OUT THE WORLD.
THIS MOVIE ABOUT AN ARTIST WITH CEREBRAL PALSY WON DANIEL DAY-LEWIS AN OSCAR FOR BEST ACTOR.
THIS MUSICAL, ABOUT A BUSKER AND AN IMMIGRANT DURING A WEEK IN DUBLIN WAS A SLEEPER HIT IN 2007. THE SONGS WERE BOTH COMPOSED AND PERFORMED BY THE TWO LEAD ACTORS.
"THE QUIET MAN" WAS DIRICTOR JOHN FORD'S HOMAGE TO HIS IRISH HOMELAND. IT STARRED MANY IRISH CHARACTOR ACTORS AND THIS LEAD ACTOR WHO'S GREAT-GREAT-GRANDFATHER WAS BORN IN IRELAND.
THIS MOVIE ABOUT IRA MEMEMBER BOBBY SANDS TAKES ITS NAME BY THIS TYPE OF STRIKE.
THIS FILM, ABOUT A TINY IRISH VILLAGE TRYING TO CLAIM THE WINNINGS OF THE IRISH NATIONAL LOTTERY, WAS ACTUALY FILMED ON THE ISLE OF MAN.
IN HIS ESSAY "A MODEST PROPOSAL", THIS ANGLO-IRISH WRITER SUGGESTED SELLING BABIES AS FOOD TO SOLVE IRELAND'S POVERTY.
THIS POET AND DRAMATIST BECAME THE FIRST IRISH NOBEL LAUREATE IN LITERATURE WHEN HE WON IN 1923.
PLAYWRIGHT SAMUAL BECKET, SAID THIS ABOUT THE TITLE CHARACTOR OF THIS PLAY - "I DON'T KNOW WHO HE IS. I DON'T EVEN KNOW IF EXISTS".
THIS PLAY HAD A SUCCESFFUL OPENING NIGHT IN LONDON IN 1895. BUT CLOSED DOWN AFTER ONLY 86 PERFORMANCES WHEN ITS ANGLO-IRISH AUTHOR WAS CONVICTED OF GROSS INDECENCY.
questions.answer: WHAT IS "THE IMPORTANCE OF BEING EARNEST"?

questions.question: THIS NOVEL IS SET IN DUBLIN ON JUNE 16, 1904. THE DATE IS NOW CELEBRATED AROUND THE WORLD AS BLOOMSDAY.
